Judul: STUDY OF FLY ASH WITH HIGH NEUTRALIZATION CAPACITY IN BLENDING AND LAYERING METHOD FOR ACID MINE DRAINAGE PREVENTION
Abstrak:
Fly ash (FA) as by-product from coal combustion of coal-fired steam power plant has been extensively used in
various technigues 10 manage acid mine drainage (AMD), either preventing the generation or mitigating its
Jormation. Previous research already pointed out the types of fly ash, distinguished based on its origin and
operating process during combustion. One of the types is fly ash with high neutralization capacity, mainly due to
the high temperature during combustion process. As a part of an integrated research to better understand fly ash
Jor its utilization regarding AMD management, this study was carried out.

Potentially acid forming (PAP) rock is the source of AMD, contained sulfide minerals that produce acidity if
weathered due to oxidation reaction. The common methods in reducing AMD generation are PAF rock
encapsulation and/or mixing/blending PAF rock with alkaline materials, hence the acidity production will be
minimized. This study aims to correlate fly ash utilization with both methods in order to recognize the most effective
use. Moreover, due to the regulation in Indonesia which classify /ly ash as hazardous material, it is important to
adeguately confirm its utilization, especially for fly ash effect to the environment. This study shows that in using
Jly ash with high neutralizing capacity, material mixing with PAF is sufficient to reduce AMD generation. In
layering method, buffering reaction from fly ash to acidic water cannot significanily increase the pH in limited
thickness. Meanwhile, blending fly ash with PAF is shown to escalate the pH to near-neutral as increasing
thickness of material mixture in positive correlation.
